column4: how do i get help here with some boot problems after installing ubuntu?
can someone help me with the following? ::: i havent been able to boot windows ever since installing ubuntu
when i try to boot from the grub boot loader menu, a screen flashes saying Grub Loading Stage 2, then goes back to the boot menu
How is your system set up? Where does the windows partition reside?
1st hd, 1st partition
And ubuntu?
i believe its hd(0,4) at least thats where its booted from when i look at /boot/grub/menu.lst
i think i messed up the partitions, but i tried every partition on my hd for booting windows, 0,0 is the only 1 that gets me anywhere (the Grub Stage 2 Loading screen)
Hmm.
You can boot into Ubuntu ok?
yes
Perhaps try creating a rescue bootdisk
And then clearing your master boot record.
That *might* let you boot into windows, and if not you can still boot into Ubuntu.
myrios: how do i create a rescue bootdisk/clear my master boot record :P
The only issue may be that your Windows bootloader is hosed for some reason.
:P
One moment, I'll get some URLs for you.
ok thanks
Balls. Forgot Ubuntuguide was down.
Okay. You can create a grub floppy by going to a terminal and typing sudo grub-floppy
hmm ok
when i run fdisk
